intro: Silene duriaei, commonly known as the Duriaei campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Silene duriaei is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
